meanings.definition: To laugh quietly or to oneself.
meanings.sent1: She would chuckle softly at the funny movie.
meanings.sent2: He tends to chuckle when he's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The baby's chuckle was contagious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: As the friends reminisced, they would chuckle at old inside jokes.
meanings.sent5: The old man would chuckle to himself as he read his favorite book.

meanings.sent1: The chuckle from the back of the room caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: Her chuckle was so infectious that soon the whole room was laughing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chuckle from the child hinted at trouble.
meanings.sent4: The chuckle of the stream as it flowed over the rocks was soothing.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet library, a sudden chuckle broke the silence.
